subject: Climate & Environment
title: What Causes a Drought
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Causes a Drought usable.

hook.text: Drought is the slow disaster. It arrives without thunder and leaves only dust and hunger behind.

buildup.text: Persistent high-pressure systems block rain clouds from reaching a region for weeks or months.

discovery.text: Some droughts are worsened by El NiÃ±o â€” a warming of Pacific waters that shifts rainfall patterns.

twist.text: Unlike floods or hurricanes, drought has no clear start date. It creeps in slowly, noticed too late.

climax.text: Climate change is making droughts longer and more intense in already dry regions.

punchline.text: The most dangerous storms are the ones that never arrive.

quiz.question: What weather pattern commonly worsens droughts?
